markdownRemark.html:
Score: 70

justjared.com  (WEB - en-US)

A celebrity and entertainment news site that also publishes pop culture gossip.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing 

Justjared.com is co-owned by its founder, Jared Eng, and his brother and CEO, Jason Eng.  They also run a teen-focused spinoff, justjaredjr.com. The site carries advertising.

Content 

Justjared.com publishes short and mostly upbeat articles about celebrities, television, music, movies, and award shows. Articles aim to “celebrate celebrities,” not “tear them down,” Jared Eng told The New York Times in 2011. Eng was Hollywood press agents’ favorite gossip blogger, The Times said, because he offers “a snark- and judgment-free zone that treats celebritydom as a kind of never-ending slumber party.”

Justjared.com states on an About page that it seeks a “fresh perspective” to the “often harsh world of celebrity news.” Articles emphasize the glamor of stardom, such as “Emily Ratajkowski Attends Grand Opening of Found Hotel in Chicago!” It covers some negative news, such as “Tom Arnold & Mark Burnett Get Into Physical Altercation at Emmys Party.” Articles often include photographs, videos, or social media posts.

Credibility 

Justjared.com often relies on interviews with stars or their representatives, press events and announcements, and exclusive access to trailers and other promotional content. Articles include their sources and are fact-based. Coverage is not overtly opinionated.

Justjared.com does not articulate a corrections policy, and NewsGuard could not readily locate corrections on the site. NewsGuard twice attempted to through its contact forms and tipline, inquiring about the site’s correction process. It has not received a response.

Transparency 

The site does not provide names or other information about editorial leadership, including Jared Eng -- who serves as editor in chief -- or content creators. Articles do not include the name of the writer.

The site’s Contact Us page offers general information for advertising, technical questions, and general inquiries, and includes an email address to send story tips. It also links to an FAQ page through which a contact form can be accessed. Email addresses for staff members are not provided. The site’s ownership is not disclosed.

Advertising is distinguished from editorial content.

Two NewsGuard attempts to contact Justjared.com through its contact forms, asking about the lack of information on ownership, leadership, and content creators did not draw a response.

History 

Jason Eng expanded a celebrity gossip blog into justjared.com in 2005, as he and brother Jason formed the media company Just Jared. In 2014, the company partnered with Townsquare Media to develop video content for its digital properties.

Written by:
Kat Harling

Edited by:
Jim Warren Eric Effron
